prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would. Find the matrix that corresponds to reflecting over the vector $\begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}.$
gpt_response:
To find the matrix that corresponds to reflecting over the vector $\begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$, we first need to find the reflection matrix for a general vector. 

Let $\mathbf{v}$ be the vector we wish to reflect over. The reflection matrix for reflecting over $\mathbf{v}$ can be defined as 
\[\begin{pmatrix} a & c \\ b & d \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} - 2\left(\frac{\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v}}{\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v}}\right)\mathbf{v}(\mathbf{v}^T\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}).\]

In our case, $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$, so $\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v} = (-1)(-1) + (3)(3) = 10$.

Plugging in this value, our reflection matrix becomes 
\[\begin{pmatrix} a & c \\ b & d \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} - 2\left(\frac{10}{10}\right)\begin{pmatrix} -1 & 3 \\ -1 & 3 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}.\]

Solving for $a,b,c,d$ we find the reflection matrix corresponding to reflecting over the vector $\begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Let $\mathbf{v}$ be the vector we wish to reflect over. The reflection matrix for reflecting over $\mathbf{v}$ can be defined as 
\[\begin{pmatrix} a & c \\ b & d \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} - 2\left(\frac{\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v}}{\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v}}\right)\mathbf{v}(\mathbf{v}^T\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}).\]

In our case, $\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$, so $\mathbf{v}^T\mathbf{v} = (-1)(-1) + (3)(3) = 10$.

Plugging in this value, our reflection matrix becomes 
\[\begin{pmatrix} a & c \\ b & d \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} - 2\left(\frac{10}{10}\right)\begin{pmatrix} -1 & 3 \\ -1 & 3 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}.\]

Solving for $a,b,c,d$ we find the reflection matrix corresponding to reflecting over the vector $\begin{pmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$.
